definition: Accounting Classification Code
Specifies whether accounting for an item is to be affected via an auxiliary account (such as a cost center).
The record of the GL account postings that resulted from posting transactions. For complex postings (more than two accounts), two or more documents are available.
Types of generic ledger accounts- such as assets and liabilities.
A subsidiary record within the general ledger that contains vendor records and the value of amounts owed (liabilities).
A subsidiary record within the general ledger that contains customer records and the value of amounts due.
Under the accrual method of accounting, revenue is recognized when revenue is earned, rather that when it is collated. Likewise, expenses are recognized when incurred rather that when paid.
Determines the type and amount of costs incurred at the individual cost centers.
A Plan for an entire project that provides management with the quantity if materials and other resources required, including when they are needed in the project timeline.
Army Knowledge Online
Unrestrictive Commitment Item used for funds distribution.
The initial distribution of authorized funding.
A Standard Financial Information Structure element. Allocation Unique Identifier is a 15 character no- intelligent number representing an allocation.
Secondary distribution of authorized funding.
Line item amount in document currency.
Army Management Structure Code
An additional order assigned to a project, increasing the planned costs of the elements to which it is assigned.
An element of the SAP Fund Master record that contains FACTS (US Treasury Reporting) relevant data; it associated with the fund.
When an appropriation has been enacted, funds are distributed by means of apportionment document authorizes each service or department to obligate funds that are supported by a US Treasury warrant.
Assistant Secretary of the Army, Financial Management and Comptroller
A method of internal cost allocation whereby costs are transferred from one cost center to receiver objects such as projects or other cost centers.
Representation of an object that is stored as collateral to be used to process data for the collateral.
Main criterion for classifying fixed assets according to legal and management requirements.
Master Data resident in GFEBS that information about specific information about an Asset.
Date of an asset transaction from the asset accounting point of view. It can be different from the posting date and document date and can be in accounting periods that are already closed.
Automated Time, Attendance and Production System
Balance sheet asset account that retains the values associated with investments prior to placing the investments into production or service.
A column on the funds Status Report that reflects values equal to budget minus the sum of commitments, undelivered orders, and expenditures.
A reports monitoring performance against specific measures.
Varying business area levels the organization for which performance measures have been established and can be captured.
Number under which an account is managed at a bank usually maintained in a vendor master record.
Unit of measure in which stocks of the material are managed. The system converts all the quantities you enter in other units of measure (alternative units of measure) to the base unit of measure.

term: Baseline date for due date calculation
definition: Date from which the period for the cash discount deadline and the due date for net payment refer.
Date from which the period for the cash discount deadline and the due date for net payment refer.
Specifies the ending of the validity period for the order.
The initial requirements budget submitted to the department of the Army Budget Office for inclusion in the President's budget for submission to Congress.

Business Intelligence
Stop the creation of a billing document for the entire sales order.
A specific item within a project against which expenses are accumulated and billed to a customer.

Specifies the beginning of the validity period for the order.

Defines the distribution of funds (authority to incur obligation) within the system.
Distinguished between different ledgers in which budget areas are stored. Budget Category is always PAYMENT.
The record of a budget posting.
The GFEBS functional business process area that included funds management, funds control, and funds distribution.

Actual funding (authority to incur obligation) is assigned to the budget structure elements. Funds must be assigned to all identified key elements before any execution can occur. For GFEBS the elements of a budget object are: Fund, Funds Center, Functional Area, Funded Program, and Commitment Item.
Defines the master data elements including hierarchies where budget structure consists of five key master data elements: funds, funds center, functional area, funded program, and commitment item.
Categorization of the type of budget (apportionment, allotment, allocation, recession, etc.) being impacted by a budget entry document.
The Portion of the general ledger that retains accounts and balances reflective of appropriations fund, authority, allotments, apportionments, commitments, and obligations.
The input screen used for creating budget entry documents within GFEBS.

An organizational unit of financial accounting that represents a separate area of operations or responsibilities within an organization and to which the value changes recorded in financial accounting can be allocated. For GFEBS, the business Area is always ARMY.
Cross Application Time Sheet
The server which supports the operation.
Cost Management Â
A Code that uniquely identifies a controlling area is the highest organizational unit controlling. GEFBS Release 1.1, the Controlling Area is "ARMY."
Chart of Accounts
Receipt of cash or electronic record of increase(s) to cash account.
Allows you to enter the SAP Easy shortcut command or Transaction Code to process transactions.

A nine digit element containing the 4 digit general ledger account code as well as a 4 digit object class/ element of resource code. Commitment Item (CI) defines how the funds are either controlled or spent. CI's are also identified in groupings by OMB object class codes and general categories such as Labor, Non-Labor, and travel.
Group of commitment items. In general, commitment item groups are referenced during reporting and analysis. Â
Smallest organizational unit of Financial Accounting for which complete self- contained set of accounts can be drawn up for purposes of external reporting. The Company Code is always ARMY.
Groups of condition types that are assigned to a given contract type to be used during subsequent processing (order, delivery billing).
An account used to accumulates costs for a fixed asset until its ready for use. Â
A code that uniquely identifies a controlling area. The controlling area is the highest organizational unit in Controlling. The Controlling Area is "ARMY."
The record of the cost posting that resulted from posting a transaction. Â
The process of assessing or distributing and one or to quantities from one sender objects.
An organizational unit within a controlling area that represents a defined location of cost incurrence. Â
A collection of cost centers. In general cost center groups are used for reporting and analysis. Â
A hierarchical structure that combines several cost centers according to a certain criteria.

A classification code used to label cost relevant items (i.e.; labor, materials, travel, etc.) the cost Element Structure mirrors the Commitment Item structure and also mirrors the general ledger account code structure. Â

Collects expenses and revenues for a particular purpose, such as research project. There are many types of cost objects. Examples include cost centers, work orders, projects, sales orders, and capital assets. Â

In cross-company code document entry, several documents are created in different company codes. A common truncation number indicates that the documents belong together logically. Transaction number can be assigned by the system or manually. The system creates the number from the document number, company code and fiscal year.
Unit in which the rate of a condition is expressed. The rate can be currency, a sales unit or a percentage. Â
Identifies a particular group of customer for the purpose of pricing or generating statistics.
Uniquely identities the material from the customer point of view.

Stop the allocation of material to the entire sales order. Â
Date on which goods are to be delivered or services performed. Â
Location from which the goods or services should be delivered to the customer.

Agreed time of delivery with the customer in the contract or the quotation. It is the time period that the customer grants the vendor from between the contract release rider until the delivery arrives.

A Standard Financial Information Structure element, Demand Unique Identifier is a data tag referenced by the Defense Corporate Repository for identifying a spending event. It is assigned when a commitment is initiated and referenced throughout obligation, expense recognition, and disbursement.
A Standard Financial Information Structure data element for the treasury Department symbol.

In compliance with the Matching Principal (GAAP), depreciation is a mechanism for deferring the expense of an asset so that the benefit received from the investment is recognized during the same accounting periods that the expense is recognized.
Text to identify the material. Â

A set of criteria that determine that content of a display or report.

Way of grouping materials, products or services. Used to determine the sales area and business area for a material, product or service.

Identifies each document in a company code in a specific fiscal year.

Explanations or notes which apply to the document as a whole.

An organizational unit which plans, controls and monitors funds and commitment budgets. In GFEBS always ARMY.

Foreign Military Sales. The FMS program is United States Government Program for transferring defense articles, services, and training to other nations and international organizations. Â
Lower limit if the G/L account numbers for which the subsequent posting periods are allowed. Â
Together with one year produces the beginning of the allowed posting period interval.

A 16 digit code that classifies the leveled of expense / cost to mission relevant categories. Incorporates AMS elements such as Major Decision Packages (MDEP), Program (PE), Budget Line Item (BLIN), and Functional Cost Code (FCC). Functional Area is an element of the Budget Object.
Represents that place at which a maintenance task is performed. Â
A defined group of specific functional areas. Functional Area groups are primarily used for funds distribution purposes. Â

A master record within SAP that represents a set of specific accounting elements for recognition of obligation (budget) authority. A Fund is referenced whenever spending occurs. Within the DoD, funds represent defined and specific authority to incur obligation as granted by Congress. Â
Within SAP funds can be grouped for purposes of reporting and analysis. Â
Defines the category of the funding.
A 24 character Funds Management data element used to restrict spending to specific project or order related efforts.
An organizational unit within financial Management area to which budget can be assigned. Â
A Grouping of funds centers. In general, funds center groups are referenced during budget distribution or during reporting and analysis. Â
A selection variant for generating the funds Status Reports by funds Center.
A SAP module where funds and funding master data is maintained as well as where funds distribution functions take place.
An organizational unit which plans, controls and monitors fund and commitment budgets. The FM Area is always ARMY.
The record of the Funds account posting that resulted from posting a transaction.

A Department of Defense documented plan to address future defense posture. This documentation and updates result in the annual budget guidance, Program Objective Memoranda and Budget Estimate Submission.
Period of time (12 months which starts 1 Oct) for which a company produces financial statements and takes inventory.

A document posted in GFEBS that verifies that a specified quantity of material or services against an order.

An account within GFEBS wherein goods receipts are posted and matched to invoices received before authorizing disbursement. After matching, these transactions clear this account and post to the appropriate liability, asset, or expense accounts.
A document that tracks the inwards movement or acknowledgement of goods and / or materials.
Contains the financial conditions and legal rules that are agreed between the sponsor and the grantee. Â
The SAP User Interface is the software on the computer or local server that allows connection to one or more of the SAP environments.

Commonly used trading terms that comply with the standards established by the International Chamber of Commerce.

A collection of information about a person, an object such as a cost object, a vendor, or general ledger account. For example record contains not only general information such as the vendors name and address, but also specific information, such as payment terms and delivery instructions.

An inventory valuation methodology mandated by OSD for all modernized accounting systems. Also referred to as Moving average Cost (MAC), it identifies the average cost per item and then multiplies that average by that average by the quantity on hand.
A term for procedures in materials planning that takes into account and plans every future requirement during the creation of procurement proposals such as independent or dependent requirement.

Used to identify exchanges of goods and services between profit centers.

Number that is cited on the apportionment document that represents the congressional session during which the law was enacted. It is also a Standard Financial Â information Structure data element that depicts the Public Law which enacted particular funding authority. Â

An obligating document used for SPS/Misc Pay/Outbound Reim and Direct Cite. This document represents a legal reservation of funds after either a contract has been signed or a service provider has agreed to provide goods and services.

Standard Financial Information Structure- a comprehensive data structure that supports requirements for budgeting, financial accounting, cost/ performance management, and external reporting across the DoD enterprise. SFIS provides an enterprise-wide standard for categorizing financial information along several dimensions to support financial management and reporting functions. Â
Customer who will receive the goods or services.

A Sap specific, unique command that tells the location of a system task. A Transaction code may contain letters only or a combination of letter and numbers. When entered into command line in SAP, the system is prompted to perform specific tasks or specific data screens for entry.

(1). Structural element in a work breakdown structure representing the hierarchical organization of a project. (2). A specific work element or function used to organize and define the total work scope of the project.
